text:
OpenClaw v2026.1.29 fixes the security mess:

- Mandatory gateway auth (no more open defaults)
- Fail-closed security model
- openclaw doctor warns about exposed gateways
- Config auto-migrates from old paths

If you're still on Clawdbot, might want to update.

Root cause: MCP implementation had no mandatory auth and granted shell access by design.

Combine that with configs stored in plaintext under ~/.clawdbot/ and a philosophy of "no guardrails as a feature" and you get... problems.

The security issues were real.

Some users had their gateway open to the entire internet. No auth. API keys, OAuth tokens, months of chat history just sitting there.

Infostealers like RedLine and Lumma started specifically targeting Clawdbot configs.
saturday 9pm. girlfriend's watching TV. i'm 47 tabs deep in clawdbot research. she knew what she signed up for.
